body:
Jeb Bush has been tied in rhetorical knots this week trying to answer whether he would have ordered the invasion of Iraq, as his brother George W. did as president in 2003. On Thursday, Mr. Bush ultimately said that “knowing what we know now,” he would not have invaded.

But fraternal questions are likely continue to dog Mr. Bush, the former governor of Florida, as he prepares to run for president. First Draft has come up with a few subjects that the Republican from Florida might be asked to consider. 

Was the expansion of Medicare’s prescription drug benefit that President Bush signed into law in 2003 a mistake?

Would you support water boarding as an interrogation technique?

Would you have cut short your vacation to oversee the response to Hurricane Katrina?

Do you think the National Security Agency should be able to eavesdrop on Americans and others in the United States without court-approved warrants?

Would you have supported the Troubled Asset Relief Program, which bailed banks out during the 2008 financial crisis?
description: First Draft comes up with a few subjects that the former governor of Florida might be asked to consider, once the questions about invading Iraq die down.
title: First Draft: Questions For Jeb Bush: Iraq Is Just the Beginning
